result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court orders increase of Cash Bail in amount of $500.00.  All conditions of bail remain as previously ordered.  Defendant to continue with Justice Point Level 4 Supervision.

Defendant Nick Nyor Allen in court.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr. appeared by video for Nick Nyor Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk for Patricia Daughtery in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court to address Justice Point violation.  State's motion on bail heard. The Court ORDERS increase of Cash Bond in amount of $500.00, for a total of $10,500.00 Cash Bail. All conditions of bail remain as previously ordered.  Defendant to continue with Justice Point Level 4 Supervision.  Court ordered the defendant to show proof of enrollment in outpatient treatment at Rogers along with the facility's plan for outpatient treatment by the next hearing date.  Case adjourned to Br 9.  Status conference remains set for November 7, 2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10.18.22, filed.

Defendant Nick Nyor Allen in court.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Nick Nyor Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Jon Josephsen for Patricia Daugherty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Defendant has complied with prior order of this court and has applied for treatment with Rogers Hospital.  The Court does not modify bail at this time and finds good cause to adjourn this matter. The Court orders Attorney Daugherty appear for the next hearing. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Supervision Report 9/28/22, filed.

Defendant Nick Nyor Allen in court.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Nick Nyor Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf  for Patricia Daughtery in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court to address Justice Point violation.  State's motion on bail heard. Court does not modify bail at this time and the motion is taken under advisement.  Court gave the defendant a verbal admonishment.  Court ordered the defendant to show proof of enrollment in outpatient treatment at Rogers along with the facility's plan for outpatient treatment by the next hearing date.  Case adjourned to Br 9.  Scheduling conference remains set for October 3, 2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 09-20-2022, filed.

Defendant Nick Nyor Allen in court with attorney Robert E Webb. Defendant appears via video.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Defense requests adjournment to allow time for charging issue to be resolved.  Court grants requests and sets matter for Adjourned Scheduling conference. Defendant advised to appear in person for next hearing. Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Supervision Report 08-11-2022, filed

Defendant Nick Nyor Allen in court, appear by video with attorney Robert E Webb, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective A. Cerqua.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Supervision Report 06-06-2022

Defendant Nick Nyor Allen in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  John J Rejowski appeared for Patricia Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Court gave the defendant a verbal admonishment. Case continues to be tabbed for preliminary hearing in preliminary hearing court scheduled for June 7th, 2022 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to Branch PH.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Supervision Report 05-27-2022
Court in receipt of a JusticePoint violation. Court scheduled a bail bond hearing with parties via email correspondence. Bail bond hearing scheduled for June 1st, 2022 at 8:15 am.

Defendant Nick Nyor Allen in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Webb is in another County; unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Supervision Report 04-26-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Violation Report 04-26-2022
Signed and filed. Sent to appointed attorney.

Defendant Nick Nyor Allen in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Supervision Report 04-05-2022, Filed.

Oral No UNSUPERVISED Contact Order with N.A., DOB 09/06/20

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Nick Nyor Allen in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Nick Nyor Allen in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nick Nyor Allen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
